verses.roman:
sudeho 'yaṁ pataty atra
devi dūraṁ hṛtas tvayā
khādanty enaṁ vṛkā gṛdhrās
tvat-prasādasya nāspadam

synonyms: su-dehaḥ—very beautiful body; ayam—this; patati—will now fall down; atra—on the spot; devi—O Urvaśī; dūram—far, far away from home; hṛtaḥ—taken away; tvayā—by you; khādanti—they will eat; enam—this (body); vṛkāḥ—foxes; gṛdhrāḥ—vultures; tvat—your; prasādasya—in mercy; na—not; āspadam—suitable.
translation: O goddess, now that you have refused me, my beautiful body will fall down here, and because it is unsuitable for your pleasure, it will be eaten by foxes and vultures.
